title: This is your chance, Riot
body:
Most, and by that I mean about 90% of all feedback concerning the Sightstone/Support Item changes is massively negative.

Riot, this is your chance to prove that you listen to your playerbase.

The only valid point about these changes is other roles abusing support items. 

While Junglers using Frostfang has already been fixed on the PBE, we still have ADCs using Targon's.

And frankly, the only way to really prevent them that I can think of that wouldn't be hard to introduce is making the item Melee only.

But that would be unfair towards Thresh.

Quite frankly, I wouldn't mind that much as someone who has over 100K points on Thresh, because the Ancient Coin line is also a viable option on him as of right now.

Or we could make Thresh an exception and just allow him to use Relic Shield even though he isn't Melee, because let's just be real here - Thresh will never be viable in any role that isn't Support.

replies.body:
The first line of your post is kind of hyperbolic in the claim that 90% of players are massively against these changes. This tends to be a wall we run up against any time we try to introduce some sort of systemic change (elemental dragons, jungle plants, adjusted cs scores on jungle camps etc), where initial outcry can be quite negative, but once players have played around with the changes they actually tend to like them (now I won't say that 100% of people do, but the vast majority). The designer who's been working on the project has been doing a load of tuning to the sightstone quest reward so that it "turns on" roughly around the same time supports are buying sightstone on live. What this means is you'll have vision around the same time as usual, but will also have that 800 gold that you can put towards a more exciting purchase.

The majority of the negative pushback (which is warranted) seems to be revolving around the idea that we're doing away with the item actives which people find exciting. While it's true that we're going to be taking it off of the gold gen items, we're going to be looking for ways to re-introduce them back to the game as soon as possible, just as new items. Who doesn't love spooky ghosts?

In regards to the poaching concern - that's something we're super aware of and will be looking to actively tune if we're off. There's a change going out for relic shield to the PBE today (was supposed to go yesterday) where we're cutting the healing for ranged users in half (this does hurt Thresh so we're going to look to buff him in another way as a fast followup should he need it). We'll see if that pushes relic far enough from desirable in every game territory for marksman, but if  it doesn't, we have other things we can try.

Appreciate your engagement with the community on this, but I'd like to say one thing about the elemental dragons.

Elemental dragons were cool and are certainly impactful on the game, but they aren't as awesome as they could have been.

IMO it would be really cool if they gave temporary or gated effects, rather than just flat buffs. What I mean is that they should give bonuses that only trigger under certain conditions and that can go on cooldown, to encourage people to really adjust their play to take advantage of them.

Instead we just have a flat damage boost against towers, and %AD/AP increase (not mentioning the others because they are already conditional. And while these are pretty cool, they could be a lot better if they were made less of a flat boost and more of a conditional effect that triggers somehow.

why not make thresh melee?

Thresh has 450 range, which is even longer than Gnar in mini form. As such, he is afforded certain strengths/weakness profiles that are more akin to a ranged champion as opposed to say - Alistar. If we were to make him Melee - we'd likely also have to take a huge chunk out of his AA, give him more hp, hp regen, armor etc. He suddenly also flips to a completely different side of the systems we have in place to safeguard and balance for the power discrepancies between ranged and melee champions. If he could suddenly apply glacial augment at melee strength from 450 range laning against him would likely become a nightmare - as an example. Or for relic shield specifically, a big part of why it even has the heal is because a melee champion is more than likely going to take harass for moving up to a wave to cs. Thresh on the other hand can again do that from 450 range, meaning he gets all the benefit, with almost none of the same cost/risk assumed by melee champs. While it sounds like a pretty simple solve - the knock on effects are actually incredibly vast and risky.

Does that explanation make sense?

But why is this a necessary part of Thresh's profile?

Thresh was released before the changes to support itemization were introduced, back when we had Kage's Lucky Pick and Philosopher's Stone. His kit is basically designed to function as a champion that has no items, and instead depends entirely on his souls as some kind of simultaneous expression of skill and determinant of game time not necessarily tied to level to give him power. You can see this in his armor, his free AP from souls, his bonus damage on his E, everything about his kit is tied to Damnation, which is an extremely powerful ability on its own.

Thresh does not need 450 range. That is far less relevant to his identity, I believe, than his identity as a warden, which is tied to items like {{item:3109}} and{{item:3302}} . Why does Thresh need to keep his 450 range? What good does it do the player? Thresh is a champion that drags people to him. He has Death Sentence and Flay to keep them in melee range. Why does he need the extra auto range?

Cutting Thresh back to something like...let's say 200 range, and then giving him the stats to accurately be called a melee champion would be a pretty huge swing for one the historically most popular champions in League. That's not to say that your critique isn't correct - to be fair I actually agree with most of what you just said, but shaking up Thresh to make him a melee champion so he can use relic shield (and other melee items) doesn't feel worth it when he's not actually posing a problem for players in his current form. To use your line, what good does that actually do for the player? (I don't mean that passive aggressively), but does making Thresh a melee champion actually make him more compelling than he currently is? Does it make him a more complete champion?

At the moment, the change does not benefit him quite as much as to justify the learning curve, I agree. However, it does have the benefit of avoiding potential future conflicts with items your team is kicking around or maybe hasn't even thought up yet. If Thresh is a Warden and will be balanced against Leona, Blitz, Alistar and Braum, and he has to get half benefit from any future Warden items you release to curb their benefits from enchanters, I think that will cause a headache in the long run.

At present, Thresh isn't suffering too much from the melee / ranged divide, but I just don't think his range is worth preserving when it means he gets shafted on future Warden items/runes.

Definitely a shared concern. I think it's important that they keep the sightstone timing roughly the same (otherwise vision is worse and it becomes even harder to keep from getting team ganked bot lane). The issue is still the gold though, because it means supports will be hitting power spikes sooner, and in the current state of the game, a support powerspike is really just a powerspike for their ADC (be it redemption, Locket, Ardent, KV, etc.) which pushes excessive power to the early game.

If anything, now is the time to nerf zeal items so that with supports popping off sooner, ADCs will be delayed a bit more in going full carry mode.

I like how perhaps the most reasonable concern in the entire thread is the one that hasn't been responded to.

I think part of the issue here is that many players and the devs have a different notion of time when it comes to the game: for someone working on gameplay, the timeline seems to operate mainly across two-week milestones, with larger updates happening every few months. For the average player, however, the game happens to them in half-hour sessions the moment they load up the client, which can make for a lot of matches before the next update. I don't know the ETA for the reintroduction of the support item actives, but I think the concern for many players is that they'll be out of the game for at least a few weeks, something that might not be alarming in designer time, but is much more so in player time. Moreover, the fact that these actives are being removed and then reintroduced, when the problem being addressed has no direct relation to them, is also what's upsetting a lot of players, since they don't really understand why they're being touched when they're not causing trouble by themselves.

So part of my concern with the changes is the fact all the cool stuff that gives me diversity of choice on the gold generating items is being removed. Will there be something added to make me want to choose one gold gen item over the other that is dependent on playstyle choice, not just stat checking?

The loss of Shield Battery makes this item not worth taking. Shield Battery was a great passive for melee supports that have to suffer through constant poke. This is a huge loss of power. There is no reason for me to take this over coin on Taric.

I like the idea behind this but I believe you're implementing this extremely badly. Instead of being forced to buy a sightstone supports are being forced to buy a different item whose main purposes are vision and gold income. Aside from the exact timing of vision coming out and the components being purchased, how is this any different from forcing everyone to buy the eye upgrade for their support item except without the quest reward? You say that this change would let us use that 800 gold for a more exciting purchase but this is making the support item itself a boring purchase that we still need to do. The only case where I can see this being an advantage is letting a support sit on a tier 2 support item while rushing another support item.
What might be a better way to implement this would be to attach extra trinket cdr to the quest reward either along with the existing reward or at a different milestone of gold earned. This way people can keep the actives and quest rewards that make the existing support items fun and also have a bit more choice about how they want to play the vision game.

As a player who greatly enjoys Sona, I think the removal of the Spellthief quest buff is going to hurt the most. 

These are champions ({{champion:37}} {{champion:117}} {{champion:432}} ) who are very slow. They have terrible base MS, and the conditional MS boost based on skill was exciting and felt like a great reward. It also helped kiting in the late game, which is something that these squishy supports are often terrible at doing (Sona in particular). 

I say this as someone who likes the SS change. I think this is going to be an overall positive for supports. But I also think it's really bad to lose the MS buff for AP supports.
I don't understand the reasoning behind introducing these changes to sightstone without also adding the items to compensate the loss of active items immediately. Like "yay, fuck supports"

I'd be more okay with this change if the actives were also implemented elsewhere at the same time. Taking one of the key parts of the support playstyle away with half hearted promises of implementing them later does not make me feel confident in this decision.

You misunderstand. I'm talking about the current actives on the income items. Ghosts, shield, ms boost. While they ARE putting these in, it will be later. and knowing Riot, it is going to more than likely not be until mid season which is bs.

> In regards to the poaching concern - that's something we're super aware of and will be looking to actively tune if we're off. 

We have seen this before. Support items get buffed or other items get nerfed (free sightstone in this case) the items get abused by other lanes (remember the mana regen work that led to FQC pickups mid) and then get nerfed for supports, leaving the role worse than we started with. 

Learn from the past or repeat your mistakes.

Do you remember Twin Shadows? I certainly do. You know what it was? It was the Frost Queen's Claim active on a standalone item. Apparently, so was the active for Talisman of Ascension, long long ago. The thing about these two items is that they were removed because no one picked them, much like {{item:3056}} and {{item:3060}} are right now. Their actives became INFINITELY more engaging once they were added to the support Tier 3 items, and they added something more interesting to the support role other than being warding donkeys.

So I don't really understand how you think that essentially bringing back these actives on items, when they were already removed from items long ago, is going to fix things. All that will do is make the active items have potential to be heavily abused by other laners. And then there's the fact that you're not bringing Face of the Mountain back AT ALL. (Let's not even start on all the champions, like Taric, who have voice lines that will essentially be deleted because you're removing these items).

In short, you're going to make the support role a helluva lot more boring. ***A sightstone is not an engaging or satisfying item. It never will be.*** Stop trying to make fetch happen. If you want to reinvent the Sightstone, take a look at some way to work it into the trinket system. Give players who buy a gold income item a special quest that upgrades their trinket into a Sightstone, and let the wards dropped by the trinket Sightstone briefly reveal wards nearby so they can still clear wards. This will allow you to keep the same Tier 3 support items AS THEY ARE, and will just allow you to nix all of the Sightstone items instead. But for the love of all the gods, don't go through with this absurd change. Tier 3 gold items are the most engaging part of supporting, and their quests are satisfying. Your goals over the years have been to make the role more engaging and more interesting, and telling people "hey, you get free vision! yayayayay! but it's not a trinket! yayayay" is possibly the most backwards thing to do, and will undo everything you've done to make Support a good position to play. Please reconsider this, and don't saddle us with this new shitty version of the sightstone at the expense of our fun items and quests.

Even if you stay with the idea for now, I think you should hold out on it. A number of players seem to hate the idea, and I'm one to them. I've heard that the idea is being considered because supports can function without rushing Sightstone, as present in the Ardent meta. But this was because having Ardent Censer was better than early vision.

This change would also make support less fun in general, since you don't have the option of rushing for Sightstone, you no longer get a quest reward for using your support item, and in cases where it may be harder to get your quest reward (Relic Shield or Ancient Coin against a hard poke bot) it can feel less fun.

I'm no game developer or balance team member, but I do play the game. Keep playtesting the change and see how people feel about it, and maybe find other ideas on ways to balance out other classes abusing support items or making supports less locked behind Sightstone. There could be a happy medium.
So you're justification for removing it is that it "might" come back?

On the other hand, you now have a free Sightstone with your gold income item.

All they need to do is re-introduce Shurelias and Twin Shadows as a support item that doesn’t suck and supports can “feel good” about being able to purchase real items rather than two bootleg income items and whatever OP healing/shielding item of the patch.

Well, what you're saying is true, but most Support mains, just like me, are not happy with losing the current Quest rewards for the sake of being able to ward because Riot removed our Sightstone. These changes are actually not really more than forcing Supports to buy a nerfed version of {{item:2303}} {{item:2302}} {{item:2301}} instead of leaving them the choice between those and the Actives ( {{item:3401}} {{item:3069}} {{item:3092}} ) combined with {{item:2045}} . Frostfang and Targon's Brace rewards are really satisfactory, Nomad's Medallion's reward is less noticeable but neat for defensive Heal/Shield-Supports, for whom this item is intended for. It's also balanced out by the advantage in Gold Generation Ancient Coin users get. That leads me to the next point: Ancient Coin users will get their "free Sightstone" way faster than everyone else, while Frostfang users are even taking risks concerning this, as they may be locked out of gold generation if their laning phase ends early, as they cannot get their Frostfang to proc without any enemy champions or turrets nearby.

And the removal of Ruby Sightstone hurts Tank/initiation supports. Alistar, Leona, Blitzcrank, Thresh, Nautilus, Braum etc. will not like the removal of Ruby Sightstone as they rely heavily on Active Items to peel for their carries, as they have few to no heals and shields in their actual kit. Leona, Blitzcrank and Nautilus don't have any shields for their allies, Alistar has his passive that will only proc if an enemy dies in the fight, Thresh only has his Lantern which is a big cooldown, and Braum also has no shield or heal in the sense of casting a spell on your ally and them being able to absorb some damage for some time after. He has his E which blocks projectiles coming from one direction and his W that will give the allied target bonus resistances, but no spells that really *shield* your ally. So the {{item:3401}} Active is nice to have, but the 20% Item CDR you get from {{item:2045}} will also help reduce cooldowns from things like {{item:3190}} {{item:3222}} {{item:3107}} {{item:3800}} etc. See where I'm going with this?

supports had only 20% item CDR for two seasons and I’ve yet to see anyone clamouring over ruby sightstone’s passive. Now that you can get 45% from runes, losing the 20% is still a net buff from before November, it’s not a big deal. Unless you’re literally using the items as they come off CD, aka fighting all in every minute mid-game, you aren’t going to notice a significant loss and that’s provided you built Ruby mid game (most get it late game when there is nothing elde to buy)

The amount of gold you can “save” from this change will be more consistent and impactful. Slot efficiency is also a big deal.

As for losing items, like I said - Riot should reintroduce with real stats. This may happen at later patch though because they may want to access how these changes impact supports first.

It’s not all bad in perspectives. Your role isn’t going to suffer if you adapt a little.

> On the other hand, you now have a free Sightstone with your gold income item.\
